title: Multimodal and Operando Synchrotron X-ray Characterization for Advanced Energy Materials
content: Advancing our fundamental knowledge of energy materials for future applications requires a mechanistic understanding of their morphological, chemical, and structural transformations. This presentation highlights the key role of multimodal and operando synchrotron X-ray characterization in advancing our understanding of these complex systems. We will discuss three categories of materials as examples, including beyond Li-ion batteries, materials used in extreme environments, such as those involving molten salts and thermal cycling, and nanoarchitecture thin films created by solid-state dealloying.
